definition: to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
to launch/to develop/to unfold/(of an exhibition etc) to open
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
to reveal/to display/to show/to exhibit sth
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to exhibit at or take part in a trade show etc
to put on display/to be on show/to exhibit
outlook/prospect/to look ahead/to look forward to

sentences.english: Meet 1 & 2 Sofa at the Shanghai InteriorLifestyle exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 壹和貳沙發在上海時尚家居展亮相。

sentences.english: No, I have to set up a display for the computer exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，我得替電腦展做好陳列。

sentences.english: Chinese boys watch a cartoon at a toy fair in Beijing on July 29 2010.
sentences.chinese: 北京的玩具展會場中，兩小男孩津津有味地在看卡通。

sentences.english: Vajpayee said he was happy to see the healthy development of India-China relations in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 瓦傑帕伊表示，印中關係近年來不斷髮展，令人高興。

sentences.english: Adaptation is a normal process of growth among children with intellectual disability and determines their level and quality in authentic life.
sentences.chinese: 適應是弱智兒童成長髮展的基本形式和趨勢。

sentences.english: Mom as an artist, please stand up. I am waiting for your company to Taipei van Gogh exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 藝術家媽媽，請你要站起來，我等你來臺北看梵谷展。

sentences.english: Fly to Munich and stay at Bauma Exhibition, or return to China.
sentences.chinese: 飛往慕尼黑參加寶馬展，或返回中國。

sentences.english: The insect-themed exhibition will be open to the public until April, 2011.
sentences.chinese: 本次沙雕展的主題爲昆蟲，將展至2011年4月。

sentences.english: The concept of intelligence has continued to evolve, despite problems with and misuses of IQ testing.
sentences.chinese: 情報的概念不斷髮展，儘管問題和誤用智商測試。

sentences.english: When the four foundations of mindfulness are developed and cultivated, they fulfill the seven enlightenment factors.
sentences.chinese: 而當四念住被髮展建立起來的時候，就能成就七覺支。

sentences.english: This news had some people at Book Expo further aggrieved.
sentences.chinese: 這條新聞讓出席圖書展的一些人更加不安。

sentences.english: The Binhai Boat Show 2011 is based on the theme of "Creating High-quality Life".
sentences.chinese: 濱海遊艇展2011年的主題是“成就品質生活”。

sentences.english: Finally, I made the textile industry heritage protection and development planning.
sentences.chinese: 最終提出了紡織城工業遺產保護髮展規劃。

sentences.english: Inquirers We nurture our curiosity, developing skills for inquiry and research.
sentences.chinese: 探究者我們培養髮展自己天生的好奇心。

sentences.english: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
sentences.chinese: 鴕鳥的翅膀歡然搧展，豈是顯慈愛的翎毛和羽毛麼？

definition: to put on display/to be on show/to exhibit
to exhibit at or take part in a trade show etc
to extend the period/to reschedule (a debt)
